actor_awards.notes: Hardy's partner Stan Laurel received an Honorary Academy Award in 1961 for their creative pioneering in cinema comedy, a recognition widely considered to honor the duo. Their film 'The Music Box' won the Academy Award for Best Live Action Short in 1932. Hardy has a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame at 1500 Vine Street.

filmography.title: Sons of the Desert
filmography.role_description: A henpecked husband who feigns a nervous breakdown to trick his wife into letting him go to a convention in Chicago, only to get caught in a lie when the ship he was supposedly on sinks.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie deceive their wives to attend the annual convention of the 'Sons of the Desert' lodge, but their scheme unravels in spectacular fashion.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (2012); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Laughs (#96)

filmography.title: The Music Box
filmography.role_description: A bumbling delivery man who, along with his partner, attempts the Sisyphean task of moving a player piano up a massive flight of stairs.
filmography.plot: Delivery men Stan and Ollie struggle to push a heavy piano up a dauntingly long flight of stairs to a house at the top, only to find they could have driven it up.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Short Subject, Comedy; National Film Registry: Inducted (1997)

filmography.title: Way Out West
filmography.role_description: A prospector who travels to the town of Brushwood Gulch to deliver a deed to a gold mine, engaging in a famous dance routine to 'At the Ball, That's All'.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie travel to the Wild West to deliver a deed to the daughter of a dead prospector, but are swindled by a saloon owner and his wife.

filmography.title: Babes in Toyland
filmography.role_description: An apprentice toymaker living in a shoe who tries to help Mother Peep pay off her mortgage and save Bo-Peep from the villainous Barnaby.
filmography.plot: Stannie Dum and Ollie Dee try to borrow money from their employer to pay off the mortgage on Mother Peep's shoe and stop the villainous Barnaby.

filmography.title: The Fighting Kentuckian
filmography.role_description: A rare solo role as a Kentucky militiaman and sidekick to John Wayne, wearing a coonskin cap and providing comic relief in a rugged western setting.
filmography.plot: A Kentucky rifleman falls for a French exile's daughter and helps thwart a plot to steal her family's land.

filmography.title: Block-Heads
filmography.role_description: A man who tries to welcome his war buddy home after 20 years, only to have his apartment and marriage destroyed by his friend's incompetence.
filmography.plot: Stan stays in the trenches for 20 years after WWI ends; Ollie brings him home to meet the wife and chaos ensues.

filmography.title: Zenobia
filmography.role_description: A well-meaning country doctor who cures a carnival elephant, causing the animal to fall in love with him and follow him everywhere.
filmography.plot: A country doctor finds himself socially ostracized when a circus elephant becomes devoted to him and refuses to leave his side.

filmography.title: The Flying Deuces
filmography.role_description: A fish market worker who joins the French Foreign Legion to forget a woman who rejected him, dragging his reluctant friend along.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie join the Foreign Legion to help Ollie forget a broken heart, but they soon realize army life isn't for them.

filmography.title: A Chump at Oxford
filmography.role_description: A street sweeper who gets a scholarship to Oxford, where he becomes the valet to his partner, who has temporarily become a genius Lord.
filmography.plot: Two street sweepers accidentally capture a bank robber and are rewarded with a scholarship to Oxford University.

filmography.title: Saps at Sea
filmography.role_description: A horn tester at a factory who develops 'hornophobia' and tries to take a restful sea voyage, only to get tangled with an escaped convict.
filmography.plot: Ollie suffers a breakdown from testing horns at a factory, so he and Stan rent a boat for some fresh air, but an escaped killer stows away.

filmography.title: Pardon Us
filmography.role_description: A bootlegger who gets sent to prison with his partner, where they accidentally participate in a jailbreak.
filmography.plot: During Prohibition, Stan and Ollie are sent to prison for selling home-brewed beer, but their bungling leads to a series of escapes.

filmography.title: Pack Up Your Troubles
filmography.role_description: A WWI draftee who, along with Stan, tries to care for the orphaned daughter of a fallen comrade while evading the welfare department.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie are drafted into WWI and, upon returning home, try to locate the grandparents of a little girl whose father was killed in action.

filmography.title: Our Relations
filmography.role_description: Hardy plays a dual role as both the respectable Ollie and his long-lost, sailors twin brother Bert.
filmography.plot: Two pairs of identical twins—one set sailors, the other respectable family men—cause confusion in a port city when their paths cross.

filmography.title: Swiss Miss
filmography.role_description: A mousetrap salesman in Switzerland who falls in love with a chambermaid, unaware she is a famous opera singer.
filmography.plot: Mousetrap salesmen Stan and Ollie travel to Switzerland, where Ollie falls in love with a woman he believes is a peasant but is actually a star.

filmography.title: Beau Hunks
filmography.role_description: A heartbroken man who joins the Foreign Legion to forget his 'Jeanie-Weanie', only to find the entire legion has been rejected by the same woman.
filmography.plot: After being rejected by his sweetheart, Ollie joins the French Foreign Legion, dragging Stan along with him.

filmography.title: The Bohemian Girl
filmography.role_description: A gypsy living in 19th-century Austria whose wife kidnaps a count's daughter, whom Ollie unknowingly raises.
filmography.plot: Gypsies Stan and Ollie face persecution in Austria while raising a girl who turns out to be a kidnapped princess.

filmography.title: Bonnie Scotland
filmography.role_description: An American who travels to Scotland with Stan to claim an inheritance, only to accidentally join a Scottish regiment in India.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie travel to Scotland to collect an inheritance but end up penniless and joining the army in India.

filmography.title: The Devil's Brother (Fra Diavolo)
filmography.role_description: A bumbling bandit who, along with his partner Stanlio, is forced to become the servant of the notorious outlaw Fra Diavolo.
filmography.plot: Stanlio and Ollio try to become bandits but end up working as servants for the legendary bandit Fra Diavolo.

filmography.title: Big Business
filmography.role_description: A Christmas tree salesman who gets into an escalating tit-for-tat battle of destruction with a grumpy homeowner.
filmography.plot: Christmas tree salesmen Stan and Ollie get into a destructive feud with a homeowner who refuses to buy a tree.

filmography.title: Helpmates
filmography.role_description: A desperate husband who asks Stan to help him clean his house after a wild party before his wife returns.
filmography.plot: Ollie asks Stan to help him clean up his house before his wife returns, but Stan's help leads to the house's destruction.

filmography.title: Air Raid Wardens
filmography.role_description: A rejected military enlistee who becomes a bumbling civil defense warden, inadvertently uncovering a Nazi spy ring.
filmography.plot: Rejected by the military, Stan and Ollie become air raid wardens and stumble upon a plot by Nazi saboteurs.

filmography.title: A-Haunting We Will Go
filmography.role_description: A vagrant who gets mixed up with a magician and a coffin that is actually being used by gangsters to transport a wanted man.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie get involved with a magician and some gangsters who are trying to smuggle a wanted man in a coffin.

filmography.title: The Bullfighters
filmography.role_description: A private detective who travels to Mexico City to catch a criminal, where his partner is mistaken for a famous matador.
filmography.plot: Detectives Stan and Ollie travel to Mexico City to catch a crook, but Stan is mistaken for a famous matador and forced into the ring.

filmography.title: Nothing But Trouble
filmography.role_description: A butler/chef who is hired by a socialite but ends up protecting a young boy king from an assassination plot.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie are hired as servants for a dinner party but end up saving a young king from his murderous uncle.

filmography.title: Atoll K (Utopia)
filmography.role_description: A man who inherits an island and shipwrecks on a new atoll, establishing a utopian government that descends into chaos.
filmography.plot: Stan inherits an island and the duo sets sail, shipwrecking on a newly emerged atoll where they establish a new government.

filmography.title: Riding High
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as a keen observer at the racetrack in this Frank Capra film.
filmography.plot: A man gives up his job and his wealthy fiancée to pursue his love for horse racing.
